issue.title: Vagrant: Configurable # of VMs, ansible_local provisioner

repository.name: mantl
repository.description: Mantl is a modern platform for rapidly deploying globally distributed services

issue.body:
This PR:
- Enables a configurable number of VMs
- Removes load_security from Vagrantfile
- Uses the new [Vagrant 1.8](https://docs.vagrantup.com/v2/provisioning/ansible_local.html) [ansible_local provisioner](https://docs.vagrantup.com/v2/provisioning/ansible_local.html)
- Creates an inventory for Ansible entirely within Vagrant, without external tools
- Thoroughly documents our Vagrant setup

It fixes #256 (more completely than #929), #499, #674, #888, #930, #941 and makes progress on #877 (with work from #929).

I suggest we either merge #929 now and then this PR, or just close #929 and focus on this one. Its work is entirely reproduced or enhanced here. 

I have tested it with varying numbers of workers, but don't have the RAM to test 3 control nodes. It'd be great if anybody could test that.

Next steps:
1. GlusterFS support
2. LVM support
3. Add edge nodes
4. Update packer scripts/mi box (@ChrisAubuchon)
5. Fix this very rare error if it still happens (unclear): http://pastebin.com/csrNsK07
6. Multi-datacenter simulation
7. Instead of `addons`, just have a list of playbooks to run with the default being `[terraform.sample.yml]`, so you can use `vagrant provision` to run other playbooks.

body:
@siddharthist Thanks for reporting this. Without digging into the code, I don't know why the `config` check phase is executed on `vagrant destroy`. This is not something specific to the Ansible provisioners though, and I'd like to check how other provisioners could be affected (or how they handle this case).

No time now, but I hope we can fix it for 1.8.2 :)

body:
I have the same problem.

```
% vagrant destroy 
No vagrant-config.yml found, using defaults
    control-01: Are you sure you want to destroy the 'control-01' VM? [y/N] y
There are errors in the configuration of this machine. Please fix
the following errors and try again:
ansible local provisioner:
* `playbook` does not exist on the guest: /vagrant/sample.yml
```

Vagrent version:

```
% vagrant version   
Installed Version: 1.8.1
```

Before  Vagrant 1.8.2 release, how can i fix that manually?
After some tinkering, I did a `vagrant halt` before `vagrant destroy`, which allowed the box to be destroyed.
For the records: This issue is finally fixed by a7ee56459b2c990550c4fc33883c55cf4145f463, which is way better than the original fix (4e451c6)

issue.body:

Vagrant 1.8.1

### Host operating system
Fedora 24

### Guest operating system
CentOS 7

### Vagrantfile
```ruby
# -*- mode: ruby -*-
# vi: set ft=ruby :

require 'socket'

hostname = Socket.gethostname

puts %Q{ This machine has the IP '#{localmachineip} and host name '#{hostname}'}

# Vagrantfile API/syntax version. Don't touch unless you know what you're doing!
VAGRANTFILE_API_VERSION = '2'

deployment_type = ENV['DEPLOYMENT_TYPE'] || 'origin'
origin_os = ENV['ORIGIN_OS'] || 'centos'
rhsm_pool = ENV['RHSM_POOL'] || 'Employee SKU'

if deployment_type == 'openshift-enterprise'
  REQUIRED_PLUGINS = %w(vagrant-registration vagrant-hostmanager landrush)
else
  REQUIRED_PLUGINS = %w(vagrant-hostmanager landrush)
end

errors = []

def message(name)
  "#{name} plugin is not installed, run `vagrant plugin install #{name}` to install it."
end
# Validate and collect error message if plugin is not installed
REQUIRED_PLUGINS.each { |plugin| errors << message(plugin) unless Vagrant.has_plugin?(plugin) }
unless errors.empty?
  msg = errors.size > 1 ? "Errors: \n* #{errors.join("\n* ")}" : "Error: #{errors.first}"
  fail Vagrant::Errors::VagrantError.new, msg
end

if deployment_type == 'openshift-enterprise'
  box_name = 'rhel/7.2'
elsif origin_os == 'centos'
  box_name = 'centos/7'
else
  box_name = 'fedora/24-cloud-base'
end

NETWORK_BASE = '192.168.50'
INTEGRATION_START_SEGMENT = 20

Vagrant.configure(VAGRANTFILE_API_VERSION) do |config|

  config.hostmanager.enabled = true
  config.hostmanager.manage_host = true
  config.hostmanager.ignore_private_ip = false
#  config.hostmanager.include_offline = true

    libvirt.cpus = 1

  end

  config.vm.synced_folder '.', '/home/vagrant/sync', disabled: true
  config.vm.synced_folder ".", "/vagrant", type: "rsync"

  config.vm.define "master1" do |master1|
    master1.vm.network :private_network, ip: "#{NETWORK_BASE}.#{INTEGRATION_START_SEGMENT}"
    master1.vm.hostname = "master1.example.com"

  end

  config.vm.define "node1" do |node1|
    node1.vm.network :private_network, ip: "#{NETWORK_BASE}.#{INTEGRATION_START_SEGMENT + 1}"

  config.vm.define "node2" do |node2|

    admin1.vm.provision :ansible_local do |ansible|
```

### Debug output
https://gist.github.com/jarrpa/cd799f5628df7527b66ee23219f1e196

### Expected behavior
`vagrant destroy` should work even if the ansible playbook is not on the guest

### Actual behavior
`vagrant destroy` does not work.

### Steps to reproduce
1. `vagrant up` but cancel before the rsync takes place
2. `vagrant destroy -f`
